definition: to separate (married couple)/to live apart (of husband and wife, family members)

to divide/to separate/to distribute/to allocate/to distinguish (good and bad)/part or subdivision/fraction/one tenth (of certain units)/unit of length equivalent to 0.33 cm/minute (unit of time)/minute (angular measurement unit)/a point (in sports or games)/0.01 yuan (unit of money)
(archaic) sentence-final particle expressing a doubting attitude
to reside/to be (in a certain position)/to store up/to be at a standstill/residence/house/restaurant/classifier for bedrooms

sentences.english: But Ms. Sanchez plans tostay separated.
sentences.chinese: 但是桑切斯小女士計劃保持分居。

sentences.english: We have agreed to a trial separation that dates back for some time.
sentences.chinese: 早在一段時間前，我們已經同意嘗試分居。

sentences.english: Deryck and I are separating and moving forward on a positive note.
sentences.chinese: 德里克和我已經分居，我們正朝着積極的方向努力。

sentences.english: My girlfriend and I are in a long-distance realationship.
sentences.chinese: 我和女朋友長期兩地分居。

sentences.english: I will scatter them in Jacob and disperse them in Israel.
sentences.chinese: 我要使他們分居在雅各家裏，散住在以色列地中。

sentences.english: After ten years of marriage they decided to separate.
sentences.chinese: 他們結婚十年後決定分居。

sentences.english: Because Wei Yingqiu in the field, they began the two separated.
sentences.chinese: 因爲魏迎秋在外地工作，他們開始了兩地分居。

sentences.english: It's being whispered about that Jack and Mary are to separate.
sentences.chinese: 傑克和瑪麗要分居的事正在暗暗傳說。

sentences.english: High Court judge Hugh Bennett pronounced the decree on the basis that the couple had not lived together for two years.
sentences.chinese: 高等法院法官休班奈特的判決是基於兩人已分居二年。

sentences.english: He and his separated wife finally made up.
sentences.chinese: 他和分居的老婆終於合好了。

sentences.english: Jane had been living apart from her husband for 3 months before she sued for a divorce.
sentences.chinese: 簡和丈夫分居三個月後請求離婚。

sentences.english: She can cite a docket of cases of endless separation.
sentences.chinese: 她能說出許多無限期分居案例的案卷摘要。

sentences.english: Two men in the separation of the met has had a thing.
sentences.chinese: 兩個人在兩地分居該遇上的事情都遇上了。

sentences.english: Friends managed to reconcile him with his wife after years of separation.
sentences.chinese: 年分居後朋友們設法使他與妻子重修舊好。

sentences.english: Harlem Yu denies rumors about their marriage and said that he and Annie didn't separate or divorce.
sentences.chinese: 庾澄慶否認婚變傳言，稱與伊能靜未分居未離婚。

definition: to be at loggerheads/to have a falling out
to part company/to split up/to break up
to be the parent of (a child)
sb who is romantically involved with sb already in a committed relationship/the other woman/the other man/third person/third party (in dispute)/disinterested party/number three in a list
